intro: Ruellia oaxacana, commonly known as Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are square and hairy. Ruellia oaxacana thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas.
